post.description:
Create a new post in your publication. The publication is identified by the API key provided in the Authorization header.

**Requirements:**
- `markdown` field is required and will be converted to TipTap JSON format
- `title` field is required

**Behavior:**
- The post will be created as published by default
- If `sendNewsletter` is true, an email will be sent to all subscribers

imageUrl.description: Optional URL to the post's cover image

sendNewsletter.description: Whether to send an email newsletter to subscribers. Default: false

slug.description: Optional URL-friendly identifier for the post. If not provided, will be generated from title

postPreview.description: Optional preview text for the post. If not provided, will be generated from content

categories.description: Optional array of category tags for the post

id.description: The ID of the created post

error.description: Technical error details or error code
Technical error details or error code
Technical error details or error code
Technical error details or error code

mcp.name: create-post
mcp.description: Create a new post in a publication

x-codeSamples.label: Create a post with markdown
Create post using curl
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST "https://public.api.paragraph.com/api/v1/posts" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer your-api-key" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"title": "My First Post", "markdown": "# Hello World"}'

post.description:
Import subscribers from a CSV file into your publication. The publication is identified by the API key provided in the Authorization header.

**File Requirements:**
- Maximum file size: 10MB
- Content type: text/csv

**Supported CSV Columns:**
- Email: `email` or `subscriberEmail` (case-insensitive)
- Wallet: `wallet_address` (case-insensitive)
- Created date: `created_at`, `subscription date`, `created`, or `createdAt` (case-insensitive, optional)

At least one of email or wallet_address must be present for each row. Rows with neither valid email nor valid wallet address will be skipped.

error.description: Technical error details or error code
Technical error details or error code
Technical error details or error code
Technical error details or error code

mcp.name: import-subscribers
mcp.description: Import subscribers from a CSV file into a publication

x-codeSamples.label: Import subscribers from CSV
Import subscribers using curl
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST "https://public.api.paragraph.com/api/v1/subscribers/import" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer your-api-key" \
  -F "file=@subscribers.csv;type=text/csv"

post.description:
Add a new subscriber to your publication. The publication is identified by the API key provided in the Authorization header.

**Requirements:**
- At least one of `email` or `wallet` must be provided
- If both are provided, the subscriber will be associated with both credentials

**Behavior:**
- If the subscriber already exists (by email or wallet), they will not be duplicated

wallet.description: Wallet address of the subscriber (0x format)

createdAt.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds) when the subscription was created. Defaults to current time.

400.description: Invalid request - must provide email or wallet

error.description: Technical error details or error code
Technical error details or error code
Technical error details or error code
Technical error details or error code

mcp.name: add-subscriber
mcp.description: Add a new subscriber to a publication

x-codeSamples.label: Add subscriber with email
Add subscriber with wallet
Add subscriber using curl
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST "https://public.api.paragraph.com/api/v1/subscribers" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer your-api-key" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"email": "reader@example.com"}'

get.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of subscribers for your publication. The publication is identified by the API key provided in the Authorization header.

**Response:**
- Returns subscriber email and/or wallet address
- Only active subscribers are returned
- Results are ordered by subscription date (newest first)

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return (1-100, default: 10)

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the subscription was created

items.description: Array of items in this page

cursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page of results

error.description: Technical error details or error code
Technical error details or error code

mcp.name: list-subscribers
mcp.description: List subscribers for a publication

x-codeSamples.label: List subscribers with pagination
List subscribers using curl
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://public.api.paragraph.com/api/v1/subscribers?limit=50" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer your-api-key"

info.title: Paragraph API
info.description:
Public API for interacting with Paragraph publications, posts, users, and coined writing.

## Rate Limiting
API requests are rate-limited to ensure fair usage. Contact support@paragraph.com for higher limits.

## Pagination
List endpoints support cursor-based pagination using `cursor` and `limit` parameters.

tags.name: posts
tags.description: Operations related to posts and content

tags.name: users
tags.description: Operations related to users and authors

tags.name: subscribers
tags.description: Operations related to subscriber management (requires API key)

apiKey.description: API key for authenticating protected endpoints. Pass as Bearer token in Authorization header.
